content:
The thiscall calling convention is used by 32-bit MSVC C++ instance methods so it is useful for interop with C++ code on Windows. There doesn't appear to be any outstanding reasons not to stabilize. See the stabilization eport.

I think it just needs someone to start the stabilization process? Would anyone be willing to do that? Sorry I'm not too familiar with the process here.
Thanks! So it still needs an fcp. Which in turn requires one team member to review and agree with the proposed stabilization.
Someone would also need to write the PR to stabilize (stabilizing the feature gate, etc). That's minor, but it's nice to have it already ready when the FCP passes so that it can be r+ed right away.
Sure! There seems to be people willing and able to put in the work so hopefully that shouldn't be an issue.
